title-group.article-title: Common fixed point results on an extended b-metric space

abstract.p: In this paper, we investigate the existence of common fixed points of a certain mapping in the frame of an extended b-metric space. The given results cover a number of well-known fixed point theorems in the literature. We state some examples to illustrate our results.

sec.title: Introduction and preliminaries
sec.p: Following this pioneering result on b-metric, a number of authors have reported several interesting results in this direction (see, e.g., [1, 2, 4–12, 14, 16, 18] and the related references therein).

sec.p: Recently, Kamran [13] introduced a new type of generalized metric space and they proved some fixed point theorems on this space.

sec.p: Adding condition (H) to the hypotheses of Theorem 2.1, we obtain that u is the unique fixed point of T.

sec.title: Proof
sec.p: Notice also that instead of hypothesis (H), one can suggest different conditions, see, e.g., [15].

sec.title: Conclusions
sec.p: On the other hand, regarding the techniques used in [15], one can derive another set of corollaries, by choosing the admissible mapping in a proper way. In this way, for example, several existing fixed point results in the literature in the setting of partially ordered metric spaces can be derived. Furthermore, the analogs of fixed point results for cyclic contractions can be found.

ack.title: Acknowledgements
ack.p: The first and third authors extend their appreciation to Distinguished Scientist Fellowship Program (DSFP) at King Saud University (Saudi Arabia). The authors thank anonymous referees for their remarkable comments, suggestion, and ideas that helped to improve this paper.

notes.title: Authors’ contributions
notes.p: All authors contributed equally and significantly in writing this article. All authors read and approved the final manuscript.

sec.title: Competing interests
sec.p: The authors declare that they have no competing interests.
